channel.title: Comments on: Michael Fishbane – Sacred Attunement – part II
channel.description: notes on Jewish theology and spirituality

item.title: By: Alan Brill
item.dc:creator: Alan Brill
item.description: That is the point- you have to press them to get their inchoate fragments, nostalgia, and submissions. It is a worldview that they have not a theology. You are using the world theology for worldview. And certainly it has not been elevated to the level of text. Fishbane loves Torah and wants feelings elevated to Torah.
item.content:encoded: That is the point- you have to press them to get their inchoate fragments, nostalgia, and submissions. It is a worldview that they have not a theology. You are using the world theology for worldview. And certainly it has not been elevated to the level of text. Fishbane loves Torah and wants feelings elevated to Torah.

item.title: By: Yonatan
item.dc:creator: Yonatan
item.description: I disagree with Fishbane's point that most Jews do not have a theology. If you press most practicing & believing Jews you could pull out a theology from them. It may not be rigorous or especially rooted in his choice of texts, but they do have an underlying theology.
item.content:encoded: I disagree with Fishbane’s point that most Jews do not have a theology. If you press most practicing & believing Jews you could pull out a theology from them. It may not be rigorous or especially rooted in his choice of texts, but they do have an underlying theology.

item.title: By: chakira
item.dc:creator: chakira
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://kavvanah.wordpress.com/2009/12/19/michael-fishbane-%e2%80%93-sacred-attunement-%e2%80%93-part-ii/#comment-250">Alan Brill</a>.
Hermeneutics is never about doing. Which thinker of the hermeneutic tradition is concerned with what do I do next?
What do I do is an ethical question, not a hermeneutical one.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Alan Brill.

Hermeneutics is never about doing. Which thinker of the hermeneutic tradition is concerned with what do I do next?

What do I do is an ethical question, not a hermeneutical one.

item.title: By: ej
item.dc:creator: ej
item.description: i don't have fishbain. i am working my way through boyarin. your post on boyarin was excellent.
item.content:encoded: i don’t have fishbain. i am working my way through boyarin. your post on boyarin was excellent.

item.title: By: Alan Brill
item.dc:creator: Alan Brill
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://kavvanah.wordpress.com/2009/12/19/michael-fishbane-%e2%80%93-sacred-attunement-%e2%80%93-part-ii/#comment-249">chakira</a>.
I am still dealing with chapter one. What was off putting in the hermeneutics of doing?
item.content:encoded:
In reply to chakira.

I am still dealing with chapter one. What was off putting in the hermeneutics of doing?

item.title: By: chakira
item.dc:creator: chakira
item.description:
What did you think of his hermeneutics of doing?
That was really off putting for me.
item.content:encoded:
What did you think of his hermeneutics of doing?

That was really off putting for me.

item.title: By: Alan Brill
item.dc:creator: Alan Brill
item.description: He seems to be doing two questions. How to awaken a presence of God? How to renew Jewish theological thinking? The url was to the rosh hashanah post on Fishbane and seems to fine. Do you have a copy of the work? Do you have the new Boyarin?
item.content:encoded:
He seems to be doing two questions.
How to awaken a presence of God?
How to renew Jewish theological thinking?
The url was to the rosh hashanah post on Fishbane and seems to fine. Do you have a copy of the work? Do you have the new Boyarin?

item.title: By: evanstonjew
item.dc:creator: evanstonjew
item.description:
The url doesn't work on my computer, so I am not clear what is the problem for which Fishbane is trying to provide an answer.
Why be frum? Why be a Jew? Why live a Jewish life? What is a Jewish life? What is (was) Judaism ? What is the future of Jew and/or Judaism? I could go on for a while.
item.content:encoded:
The url doesn’t work on my computer, so I am not clear what is the problem for which Fishbane is trying to provide an answer.

Why be frum? Why be a Jew? Why live a Jewish life? What is a Jewish life? What is (was) Judaism ? What is the future of Jew and/or Judaism? I could go on for a while.
